qas.question: Who was the chief engineer at the United States Electric Lighting Company?
Where did Electro-Dynamic Light Company install its first lights?
When did Electro-Dynamic Light Company install its first lights?
Which company was organized first, Electro-Dynamic Light Company or United States Electric Lighting Company?
Who began the Electro-Dynamic Light Company in 1890?
Whose other patents did Albon Man not exploit?
Where was the first installation of incandescent lamps in 1890?
Who was the chief architect at the United States Electric Lighting Company?
Who did not make their first installation until the spring of 1880?

context: <a0_0><b5_0>Albon Man<b5_0/><a0_0/>, a New York lawyer, started <a4_0>Electro-Dynamic Light Company<a4_0/> in 1878 to exploit his patents and those of <b6_0>William Sawyer<b6_0/>. Weeks later the <b9_0>United States Electric Lighting Company<b9_0/> was organized. This company didn't made their first commercial installation of incandescent lamps until the <a3_0>fall of 1880<a3_0/> at the <a2_0><b7_0>Mercantile Safe Deposit Company<b7_0/><a2_0/> in New York City, about six months after the Edison incandescent lamps had been installed on the Columbia. <a1_0><b8_0>Hiram S. Maxim<b8_0/><a1_0/> was the chief engineer at the United States Electric Lighting Company.
